result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy W Hetrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy W Hetrick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy W Hetrick was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the debt is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy W Hetrick

records.addlTxt: 03:33 PM Defendant Jeremy W Hetrick in court.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: guilty to Ct#1 with court costs ($443). Dismiss Ct#2-3. Defendant agrees. Court goes over waiver of right to attorney.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1.   Court finds Defendant is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights and waiver of right to attorney. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Def guilty of Ct#1 and dismisses Ct#2-3. DA Hatch addresses sentencing. Court orders court costs ($433), due in 6 months and DNA sample within 30 days.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 340
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

03:59 PM Defendant Jeremy W Hetrick in Court pro se.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes before going on the record she was informed that Defendant needs to follow-up on AODA.  4:00 PM  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to possess controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Comply with any cases that involve his child.

10:03 AM Defendant Jeremy W Hetrick appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs DE of charges, and possible penalties and rights. DDE understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. NG. DA Hatch is requesting a $1,000.00 SIBS w/AS, Not to Possess and Comply w/any cases regarding his child, no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 10:06 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
